blocks.name: df-2idl
blocks.content: Define the class of two-sided ideals of a ring. A two-sided ideal is a left ideal which is also a right ideal (or a left ideal over the opposite ring). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-Jun-2015.)

blocks.name: 2idlval
blocks.content: Definition of a two-sided ideal. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-Jun-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm 2idlval(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wceq(c0, cin(c1, c2))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(clidl, c3))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(coppr, c3))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(clidl, c4))
  -| wceq(c0, cfv(c2idl, c3))
} = {
  eqtri(c0, cin(c1, c2), cfv(c2idl, c3))
  pm2.61i(wceq(cfv(c2idl, c3), cin(c1, c2)), wcel(c3, universe))
  fvmpt(hs0, c3, universe, c2idl, cin(c1, c2), cin(cfv(clidl, cv(hs0)), cfv(clidl, cfv(coppr, cv(hs0)))))
  ineq12d(cfv(clidl, cv(hs0)), cfv(clidl, cfv(coppr, cv(hs0))), c1, c2, wceq(cv(hs0), c3))
  syl6eqr(cfv(clidl, cv(hs0)), c1, cfv(clidl, c3), wceq(cv(hs0), c3))
  fveq2(cv(hs0), c3, clidl)
  syl6eqr(cfv(clidl, cfv(coppr, cv(hs0))), c2, cfv(clidl, c4), wceq(cv(hs0), c3))
  fveq2d(clidl, cfv(coppr, cv(hs0)), c4, wceq(cv(hs0), c3))
  syl6eqr(cfv(coppr, cv(hs0)), c4, cfv(coppr, c3), wceq(cv(hs0), c3))
  fveq2(cv(hs0), c3, coppr)
  df-2idl(hs0)
  inex1(c1, c2)
  fvexi(c1, clidl, c3)
  eqtr4d(cfv(c2idl, c3), cin(c1, c2), emptycls, wn(wcel(c3, universe)))
  fvprc(c3, c2idl)
  sylancr(wn(wcel(c3, universe)), wceq(cin(c1, c2), emptycls), wss(cin(c1, c2), c1), wceq(c1, emptycls))
  inss1(c1, c2)
  syl5eq(c1, emptycls, cfv(clidl, c3), wn(wcel(c3, universe)))
  fvprc(c3, clidl)
  sseq0(cin(c1, c2), c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(universe)
  diff.hs0.c(cin(c1, c2))
}

thm 2idlval(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  ‚ä¢ c0 =(c1 ‚ãÇ c2)
  ‚ä£ c1 =(LIdeal ` c3)
  ‚ä£ c4 =(oppR ` c3)
  ‚ä£ c2 =(LIdeal ` c4)
  ‚ä£ c0 =(2Ideal ` c3)
} = {
  eqtri(c0, (c1 ‚ãÇ c2), (2Ideal ` c3))
  pm2.61i((2Ideal ` c3)=(c1 ‚ãÇ c2), c3 ‚àà ùïå)
  fvmpt(hs0, c3, universe, c2idl, (c1 ‚ãÇ c2), ((LIdeal ` hs0)‚ãÇ(LIdeal `(oppR ` hs0))))
  ineq12d((LIdeal ` hs0), (LIdeal `(oppR ` hs0)), c1, c2, hs0 = c3)
  syl6eqr((LIdeal ` hs0), c1, (LIdeal ` c3), hs0 = c3)
  fveq2(hs0, c3, clidl)
  syl6eqr((LIdeal `(oppR ` hs0)), c2, (LIdeal ` c4), hs0 = c3)
  fveq2d(clidl, (oppR ` hs0), c4, hs0 = c3)
  syl6eqr((oppR ` hs0), c4, (oppR ` c3), hs0 = c3)
  fveq2(hs0, c3, coppr)
  df-2idl(hs0)
  inex1(c1, c2)
  fvexi(c1, clidl, c3)
  eqtr4d((2Ideal ` c3), (c1 ‚ãÇ c2), emptycls, ¬¨ c3 ‚àà ùïå)
  fvprc(c3, c2idl)
  sylancr(¬¨ c3 ‚àà ùïå, (c1 ‚ãÇ c2)= ‚àÖ, (c1 ‚ãÇ c2)‚äÜ c1, c1 = ‚àÖ)
  inss1(c1, c2)
  syl5eq(c1, emptycls, (LIdeal ` c3), ¬¨ c3 ‚àà ùïå)
  fvprc(c3, clidl)
  sseq0((c1 ‚ãÇ c2), c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(universe)
  diff.hs0.c((c1 ‚ãÇ c2))
}

blocks.name: qusring
blocks.content: If ` S ` is a two-sided ideal in ` R ` , then ` U = R / S ` is a ring, called the quotient ring of ` R ` by ` S ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-Jun-2015.)

blocks.name: qusrhm
blocks.content: If ` S ` is a two-sided ideal in ` R ` , then the "natural map" from elements to their cosets is a ring homomorphism from ` R ` to ` R / S ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-Jun-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm qusrhm(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {

  -| wceq(c2, cfv(c2idl, c0))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cbs, c0))
  -| wceq(c3, cmpt(s0, c5, cec(cv(s0), co(c0, cqg, c1))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
} = {
  isrhm2d(hs0, hs1, c3, c0, c4, c5, cfv(cur, c0), cfv(cur, c4), cfv(cmulr, c0), cfv(cmulr, c4), wa(wcel(c0, crg), wcel(c1, c2)))

  simprd(wa(wcel(c0, crg), wcel(c1, c2)), wceq(cec(cfv(cur, c0), co(c0, cqg, c1)), cfv(cur, c4)), wcel(c4, crg))

blocks.name: crng2idl
blocks.content: In a commutative ring, a two-sided ideal is the same as a left ideal. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-Jun-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm crng2idl(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, ccrg), wceq(c1, cfv(c2idl, c0)))

} = {

  syl5eqr(c1, cin(c1, cfv(clidl, cfv(coppr, c0))), cin(c1, c1), wcel(c0, ccrg))

  ineq2d(c1, c1, cfv(clidl, cfv(coppr, c0)), wcel(c0, ccrg))

  eqid(cfv(coppr, c0))
  eqid(cfv(clidl, cfv(coppr, c0)))
  eqid(cfv(c2idl, c0))
}
